column1: Red peppers—Average retail price per pound and per cup equivalent, 2016

1Includes sweet, red bell peppers. It is assumed that the peppers are eaten raw. The USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference (SR) reports that 82 percent of the weight of raw, sweet, red pepper is edible.

Source: Calculated by USDA, Economic Research Service, from 2016 IRI Infoscan data; the USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference (SR), Release 26; and the Food Patterns Equivalents Database (FPED) 2013-14 as well as the FPED's accompanying Methodology and User Guide.
